channel.title: Funny? sort of
channel.description:
AN ENGINEERING MASTER PIECE
During the construction phase...... Dubai, United Arab Emirates
[IMG]http://img225.imageshack.us/img225/9858/image001im5.jpg[/img]
All finished. Notice the size of the palm trees outside..........
[IMG]http://img99.imageshack.us/img99/6153/image002af5.jpg[/img]
Remember, this is in the middle of the desert.... The very HOT desert where temperatures get up to 120 degrees.....
Unbelievable!
But true....
The INSIDE view:
[IMG]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/79/image003ur2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://img84.imageshack.us/img84/557/image004vn2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://img99.imageshack.us/img99/7306/image005fy8.jpg[/img]
Now you know why petrol is
£1. 00 a litre for unleaded?
So they can ski in the F#*@ING desert!!!

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @fezz fezz
item.description:
@fezz wrote:

[quote=“Sepranem, post:23, topic:64994”]Oh. :o Didn’t know you knew what they meant.

In that case, I ought to expand your knowledge a bit.

Khawal means “gay person”, sharmout means “man-whore”, sharmouta means “whore”, couss means “pussy”, and sees means “fag”. If anyone calls you one of those, or something that sounds close to it, drop him.

What part of Egypt btw?[/quote]

w000t i cant wait to tell my parents those words when i get pissed!

Read full topic

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:24, topic:64994”][quote author=Sepranem link=topic=94338.msg985937#msg985937 date=1173401753]
Oh. :o Didn’t know you knew what they meant.

In that case, I ought to expand your knowledge a bit.

Khawal means “gay person”, sharmout means “man-whore”, sharmouta means “whore”, couss means “pussy”, and sees means “fag”. If anyone calls you one of those, or something that sounds close to it, drop him.

What part of Egypt btw?
[/quote]

Luxor both times, I’ve also visited Cairo and Aswan. I also knew all of those words except for couss and sees. We know English people that live out their and have some good Arabic friends. I also the nubby way of saying “don’t touch me”, la lamps(can’t spell that either lol) but I know that means just no and touching.[/quote]

Cool, I haven’t been to Luxor before. It’s fuckin’ hot there. I live in Cairo.

And the non-makeyourselflookdumb way of saying don’t touch me is “matilmisnish”.

Read full topic

What part of Egypt btw?[/quote]

Luxor both times, I’ve also visited Cairo and Aswan. I also knew all of those words except for couss and sees. We know English people that live out their and have some good Arabic friends. Oh. :o Didn’t know you knew what they meant.

In that case, I ought to expand your knowledge a bit.

Khawal means “gay person”, sharmout means “man-whore”, sharmouta means “whore”, couss means “pussy”, and sees means “fag”. If anyone calls you one of those, or something that sounds close to it, drop him.

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Sepranem, post:21, topic:64994”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=94338.msg985564#msg985564 date=1173389634]

ZOMG! YOU SPEAK ARABIC!!!

i’m not that good at speaking it on here, so you’ll have to bear with me

a ana min masr, ana quais, wa enta ezayak caman?

wow that was hard lol XD i speak fluent arabic but i cant type it lol

Ana kwayes, hamdellah ya3nii. Mish tayi2 el mozakra, bas 2a3mil eih ya3nii? lol. Guess I’ll have to deal.

I speak pretty fluent Arabic (I’m half-Egyptian), but I’m new to reading and writing it. I lived in the states for most of my life so I never had a need to write Arabic. When I moved to Egypt last summer, I didn’t even know the alphabet, but now I’m at a grade 2 level. Yeah, it sounds embarrassing, but hey, not many people can learn 2 (almost 3) years of Arabic in one year. Anyways, you know the TGI Friday’s in Maadi? I live next to there.

All I know(sorry if you find this offensive) is metnaka(can’t spell :|) and ma fech feluce? (Can’t spell either.
[/quote]

LMFAO!!!

Don’t ever say metnaka to ANY arab. It means “fucked one”…kindof like fucker, but over here it’s taken MUCH more seriously. And the second one means “there’s no money”.[/quote]

I know what both mean lol I’ve been to Egypt twice. I know you live there.

Read full topic

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @fezz fezz
item.description:
@fezz wrote:

lol, i’m 100% egyptian i left cairo when i was 2 years old and we moved to the states lol, unfortunately i havent been to egypt in a year and we arent going back because of something that occured in the family ;(

i taught myself arabic from listening to conversations and watching the shows

Read full topic

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

[quote=“fezz, post:15, topic:64994”]ZOMG! YOU SPEAK ARABIC!!!

i’m not that good at speaking it on here, so you’ll have to bear with me

a ana min masr, ana quais, wa enta ezayak caman?

wow that was hard lol XD i speak fluent arabic but i cant type it lol[/quote]

Ana kwayes, hamdellah ya3nii. Mish tayi2 el mozakra, bas 2a3mil eih ya3nii? lol. Guess I’ll have to deal.

I speak pretty fluent Arabic (I’m half-Egyptian), but I’m new to reading and writing it. I lived in the states for most of my life so I never had a need to write Arabic. When I moved to Egypt last summer, I didn’t even know the alphabet, but now I’m at a grade 2 level. Yeah, it sounds embarrassing, but hey, not many people can learn 2 (almost 3) years of Arabic in one year. Anyways, you know the TGI Friday’s in Maadi? I live next to there.

Read full topic

item.title: Funny? sort of
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Although, their oil supplies are running out…fast. They are building of all this now, so when their oil runs out, which is very soon, they can make their money from tourism.

Good find. Looks awesome. Going to Dubai in the summer. I’ll make sure I go to that.

Read full topic

[quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=94338.msg978456#msg978456 date=1173190344]Now you know why petrol is

£1. 00 a litre for unleaded?

So they can ski in the F#*@ING desert!!! [/quote]

Actually, in Egypt, Cairo 1 litre of petrol for unleaded is 13 English pence. I’m sure our and their goverments make up atleast 25p each a litre and the petrol companys make something.
[/quote]

w000t i’m from cairo and my cousins live in the emirates,

i’m pretty sure they have this in egypt also, i’ve heard of it.

you might think its silly, but many people there have always wanted to ski or even just to feel snow, but they cant afford leaving their country, i dont really think its that funny…[/quote]

Enta min fein fe masr? Ana min el ma3adi. Ezayak, 3mel eih?

Read full topic
